title: How to Kill Bed Bugs with Heat

methods.name: Hiring Professionals to Heat-Treat Your Home

steps.headline: Get a quote from a local pest management company.
steps.description: Pest management companies can bring in special equipment that will super-heat your home and everything in it. This will kill the bed bugs without damaging your items or requiring you to launder everything. However, this can be an expensive option. Companies often charge between $1 to $3 (US) per square foot, and the average total cost may range from $2,000 to $4,000 for a whole home heat treatment. Call and ask for a quote before you hire someone to heat-treat your home. You may want to compare multiple companies to find one that is within your price range. Keep in mind that even after heat treatment, you might still need chemical control methods to prevent the bed bugs from returning.

steps.headline: Prepare your home according to the company’s instructions.
steps.description:
Since your home will be very hot inside during the treatment, it’s important to follow the company’s instructions carefully. This will help to protect your belongings and increase the effectiveness of the heat treatment. Some things the company may want you to do before they arrive include:
Moving all of your furniture 3 ft (0.91 m) from the walls. Placing items that might melt or be damaged by heat into your refrigerator, such as medications, candles, and chocolate. Spacing out the clothing in your closets to allow air to circulate around them. Placing blankets and towels loosely in open weave baskets. Putting flammable items into a “do not heat” box.

steps.headline: Plan to leave your home for the entire heat treatment.
steps.description: Everyone will need to leave for the day, including any pets that live in your home. Ask the pest control professionals how long the heat treatment will take and when you can return home. You could ask a friend or family member if you can spend the day with them while your home is being treated. Another option is to make a day of it and go to a nearby attraction, such as an amusement park or zoo, on your own or with your family. Tip: Make sure that you tell the pest control professionals if you have a small pet, such as a hamster or turtle. You may need to take the animal out of the home for the day, or the professionals might be able to keep it outside of the home for you.

steps.headline: Wash any items that you wear out of your home.
steps.description: Bring a change of clean clothing sealed in a plastic bag. Change into these clothes and immediately wash and dry the soiled clothing at a laundromat or a friend’s home. This is important to avoid reintroducing bed bugs into your home when you return. Make sure that the washer is set to hot and the dryer is set to high heat. A temperature of at least 120 °F (49 °C) is required to kill bed bugs.

methods.name: Using Heat to Treat Clothing and Linens

steps.headline: Use 120 °F (49 °C) water to wash clothing and linens.
steps.description:
Place your clothing and linens into a dryer and wash them on hot with your usual detergent. The temperature of the water needs to reach 120 °F (49 °C) to kill the bedbugs. Since you will need to wash everything in your home, you may have to do several loads to clean it all. The items you will need to wash include:
Clothing
Towels
Sheets
Blankets
Curtains
Rugs
Tablecloths

steps.headline: Dry your clothing and linens on high heat for 72 minutes.
steps.description: After you finish washing a load of laundry, put the laundry into the dryer and dry it on the highest heat setting. The temperature of your dryer needs to reach at least 120 °F (49 °C) to kill the bed bugs. Leave the items in the dryer for at least 72 minutes. This is the amount of time that is usually required to fully eradicate all of the eggs and mature bed bugs. Some dryers have a “sanitize” setting, which is ideal. However, some dryers may only have a “high” setting, and this will still work fine as long as you leave your clothing and linens in the dryer for the entire 72 minutes.

steps.headline: Place dry-clean only items right into the dryer without washing them.
steps.description: If you have clothing items that are labeled as “dry-clean only,” you can still place these items into your dryer to kill the bed bugs. Drying the items without washing them is unlikely to damage them. Place the items into the dryer and run the dryer on the highest setting for 72 minutes to kill the bugs. Try placing a dryer sheet in with your dry-clean only items to freshen them up while you treat the bed bugs.Tip: If you have a special garment that you are not comfortable putting into your dryer, then you can have it dry cleaned to kill the bed bugs. However, avoid taking items to a dry cleaners without asking them first. The bed bugs on your items may infest the dry cleaners if they are not aware of the problem.

steps.headline: Place dry items in black plastic trash bags on a hot, sunny day.
steps.description: If you’re unable to wash your items, then another option is to place them into black plastic trash bags and then put them outside in the sun. The temperature of the bags needs to reach 120 °F (49 °C) to kill the bed bugs. Leave the bags outside in the sun for 7-8 hours. Then, take your items out of the bags and bring them back into your home. For best results, make sure to put the items out during the hottest, brightest part of the day, such as late morning through the early afternoon. You can also place the trash bags into a car that is parked in a sunny spot. Just make sure to roll up the windows to make it as hot as possible inside the car!

steps.headline: Kill bed bugs on backpacks, shoes, and luggage with a portable heating device.
steps.description: You can purchase special heating devices meant for decontaminating items that have been infested with bedbugs. Plug in a portable heating device, place items inside it, seal it, turn it on, and let the device run through its cycle to kill the bed bugs. This is a good option for killing bed bugs on suitcases, backpacks, shoes, and other items that you cannot put into a washer. However, you will have to buy the device, which can be expensive. The items need to be heated to at least 120 °F (49 °C) to kill the bed bugs. Look online for heating-treatment devices. These often look like a large suitcase. Simply aiming a space heater or hair dryer at an item won’t be enough to kill the bedbugs. They need to be enclosed and the entire area needs to be heated to kill them.

steps.headline: Use a steamer to kill bed bugs in carpets and on other surfaces.
steps.description: A steam cleaner can reach very high temperatures, well above 120 °F (49 °C), so it is an effective way to treat carpets and other surfaces. Fill the steamer tank with water, switch it on, and aim the nozzle at the area you want to treat. If you steam the curtains along with the floors, start with the curtains and work down. Clean each room from top to bottom. Steam cleaners can be expensive to purchase, but you can also rent them.Warning: Don’t use a carpet steamer to treat your home for bed bugs. You will need to get a steam cleaner that reaches temperatures of 120 °F (49 °C) or higher to kill the bed bugs.
